page.title: 14CHANGES IN EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Lydbrook-changes in employment. Although a rural area few people are employed on farms or by the Forestry Commission.Many local people were employed by Rank Xerox at Mitcheldean but there have been drastic redundancies.There are four main employers in the Lydbrook valley. "Lydwood",a small factory employing 18 people,mostly local,making sports shields,trophies and furniture. "Rothdean"a haulage company with 24 employees-all local except one. "Reeds"-a paper making factory employing 450 people,a third of whom are from Lydbrook area.Several fathers of Joys Green School children work at Reeds and families attend the firms annual Christmas parties.A new haulage company,Lyndsley Morgan"has just opened in Lydbrook.High percentage unemployment.
